conclusion: Analyze forces acting on blocks A and B for equilibrium.
Block A is on a 30° inclined plane, connected by a rope through pulleys.
Gravitational force on block A is mg, acting downward.
Component of gravitational force on A parallel to slope is mg sin(30°).
Component of gravitational force on A perpendicular to slope is mg cos(30°).
Tension in the rope acts along the rope.
Net force along slope must be zero for A to be stationary.
Component of gravitational force along slope is mg sin(30°) = mg/2.
Component of tension along slope is T cos(30°) = T √3/2.
Gravitational force on block B is m_Bg, acting downward.
Tension in the rope acts upward on block B.
Equilibrium condition for B: T = m_Bg.
